items.content_html:
This PR removes the applet HTML element from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v9.1.0).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/html/elements/applet
items.title: Remove applet HTML element from BCD

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR updates the compat data for the Storage Access API, which is being shipped in Chrome 113. In particular I:

  • Did updates to hasStorageAccess()/requestStorageAccess()
  • Added storage-access permissions policy directive
  • Updated sandbox="allow-storage-access-by-user-activation" to say supported in Chrome

Note: I have added a number of notes about the type of behavior implemented by different browsers for requestStorageAccess(). This is not really normal for BCD, in that they are talking about "old spec, new spec" differences rather than browser-specific implementation differences. But I thought these differences needed to be highlighted, as they are pretty important, security-wise.

See my research document for the overall details of what this project entails.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Update Storage Access API data

items.content_html:
This PR is a breakdown list of all the changes created by https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com. This PR will be continuously updated, both on every new collector release and as needed.

Current results: collector v9.1.0, generated April 28, 2023
items.title: mdn-bcd-collector v9.1.0 breakdown list (2023-04-28)

items.content_html: This PR removes the RTCRtpEncodingParameters API from BCD. This feature is a type (ex. a dictionary, enum, mixin, constant or WebIDL typedef) that we have explicitly stated not to document separately from the feature(s) that depend on it, as they are virtually invisible to the end developer.
items.title: Remove RTCRtpEncodingParameters API from BCD

items.content_html: This PR removes the RTCRtpContributingSource API from BCD. This feature is a type (ex. a dictionary, enum, mixin, constant or WebIDL typedef) that we have explicitly stated not to document separately from the feature(s) that depend on it, as they are virtually invisible to the end developer.
items.title: Remove RTCRtpContributingSource API from BCD

items.content_html:
This PR removes the RTCIceServer API from BCD. This feature is a type (ex. a dictionary, enum, mixin, constant or WebIDL typedef) that we have explicitly stated not to document separately from the feature(s) that depend on it, as they are virtually invisible to the end developer.

Additional Notes: I'd love for someone to take on the content changes if possible, but if nobody is interested I'd be happy to give the content updates a shot!
items.title: Remove RTCIceServer API from BCD
